note: In global statistics, “tuberculosis deaths” typically refers to deaths in HIV-negative people, while tuberculosis deaths among people with HIV are classified under “HIV/AIDS related deaths”. Here, the composition of HIV/AIDS related deaths is broken down to better understand the impact of tuberculosis in people with HIV/AIDS.
title: Number of deaths from tuberculosis and other diseases in people with HIV/AIDS
subtitle: Estimated number of deaths from [tuberculosis](#dod:tuberculosis) versus other causes, among people with [HIV/AIDS](#dod:hiv_aids). This is broken down by type of tuberculosis, including [drug-resistant tuberculosis](#dod:drug-resistant-tuberculosis).
